Key Arguments: The legislation is considered poorly thought out and potentially a case of government overreach.
It could lead to the suppression of ideas contrary to the government's narrative, threatening freedom of speech.
The proposal is seen as leading to an Orwellian future where minorities cannot speak freely.
The best way to combat misinformation is through public debate, not government intervention.
The legislation could result in more misinformation and disinformation, not less.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a non-negotiable freedom.
Better to allow the most utter lies to be aired than suppress the slightest sliver of truth.
The best way to combat misinformation and disinformation is to have robust debate in the public space.
